abstract: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup reported a total of $10.2 billion in profits for the quarter that relied on investment banking and asset sales to counter losses on consumer loans.
snippet: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup reported a total of $10.2 billion in profits for the quarter that relied on investment banking and asset sales to counter losses on consumer loans.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup, the three biggest lenders in the United States, reported a total of $10.2 billion in profits for the second quarter that relied on investment banking and asset sales to counter growing losses on consumer loans, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Investment Banking Hums, But Loan Losses Grow
